Name: *Ayer Puteh*
Locality: Slope of Gunung Ledang north of Sagil
Description: Cascade near the Gunung Ledang Visitor Center. Seasonal

Name: *Kota Tinggi*
Locality: 15 km north-west of Kota Tinggi town
Description: Attractive waterfalls in over-commercialised surroundings. Ridiculous entrance fee

Name: *Puteri Fall*
Description: Waterfall on the slopes of the Gunung Ledang. The Puteri Fall is a popular family destination. The upper fall requires trekking (guide compulsory)

Name: *Sg Pulai*
Locality: 15 km north of Pekan Nenas on the slopes of Gunung Pulai
Description: Hardly visited nice falls in derelict recreation park

Name: *Taka Melor*
Description: Hardly visited waterfall and unspoilt too due to its remote location.

Name: *Asahan fall*
Description: Not a lot of water but a nice pool

Name: *Jeram Tinggi*
Description: Waterfall on the northern slope of Gunung Ledang

Name: *Lemako Falls*
Description: Unspoilt waterfalls in Endau Rompin N.P.

Name: *Pelepah Falls*
Description: Relatively unknown falls near the Kota Tinggi falls. Nice series of many falls and Cascades

Name: *Selai falls*
Locality: Taman Negara Endau Rompin 20 km NE of Bekok
Description: Waterfalls of the Selai river in an unknown part of Endau Rompin. Takah TInggi is an impressive fall with high volume. Smaller falls in tributaries

Name: *Sg Yong*
Locality: On the slopes of Gunung Belumut off the Kluang Mersing Road
Description: A seven tiers waterfall on the slopes of Gunung Belumut in pristine surroundings

Name: *Upeh Guling*
Description: Impressive waterfall in the Jasin river

Name: *Buaya Sangkut*
Description: Most people will visit this dramatic fall on a trekking along the river with overnight camping

Name: *Tengkil Falls*
Description: Remote series of Cascades  and falls. Unspoilt.

Name: *Alur Naga Fall*
Description: Nice vertical fall and easily accessible from the Gunung Jerai Regency resort

Name: *Badak Fall*
Locality: Hutan Lipur Sungai Badak near Gurun
Description: Unknown waterfall in pretty surroundings

Name: *Batu Hampar Yan*
Description: Recreation park with a few small waterfalls

Name: *Bukit Hijau*
Description: A well maintained recreation park with beautiful Cascades  and falls

Name: *Durian Perangin*
Description: Attractive and well-maintained recreational park with some nice falls. Seasonal.

Name: *Junjong waterfall*
Description: Popular waterfalls not far from Kulim

Name: *Lata Bayu*
Description: Well maintained park and a popular weekend destination.

Name: *Lata Hujan Lebat*
Description: Remote fall in Northern Kedah. Clear water and pristine surroundings

Name: *Lata Mengkuang*
Locality: 12 km from Sik near the Thai border
Description: A nice waterfall in remote surroundings

Name: *Perangin Sik*
Description: A recreation park with a cascade and a small fall

Name: *Puteri Mandi*
Description: Seasonal Fall

Name: *Serdang Falls*
Description: Popular recreation park. Fals also know as Batu Hampar falls

Name: *Telaga Tujoh*
Description: The fall is at its best in the rainy season September/October. The name comes from the seven pools at the top of the fall

Name: *Temurun Waterfall*
Locality: Pulau Langkawi road to Damay Bay Resort
Description: Tallest fall of Langkawi. Seasonal

Name: *Ulu Paip*
Description: Recreational Forest with some rapids and a small waterfall.

Name: *Batu Hampar*
Description: Situated in a Rubber Estate

Name: *Perigi Falls*
Description: Seasonal Fall. Climbing up will be problematic during the rainy season

Name: *Sg Jagong Falls*
Locality: Not in Kedah but in Croatia!
Description: An email about these falls has been circulating on the Internet for years already. It is a hoax. There are no Sg Jagong waterfalls.

Name: *Jeram Linang*
Description: Popular nature park with some small waterfalls

Name: *Jeram Pasu*
Locality: Eight km south-west of Pasir Puteh
Description: A popular waterfall near Kota Baharu. A bit over-developed but a nice destination for a relaxing bath

Name: *Lata Berangin*
Description: A powerful fall in a remote region. Easy access

Name: *Lata Janggut*
Description: Easy access. Waterfall not spectacular but beautiful erosion of the rocks

Name: *Lata Kertas*
Description: Easy access from the D29 road. Rundown place but the waterfall is nice

Name: *Lata Rek*
Locality: Between Gua Musang and Kuala Krai
Description: Seasonal water flow. Impressive when flow is big enough

Name: *Stong Fall*
Description: Also known as Jelawang Fall. Supposedly the tallest waterfall in South-East Asia

Name: *Jeram Belihoi*
Description: A small roadside falls spoilt by rubbish dumping

Name: *Jeram Dagang (Gajah)*
Description: Small waterfall with easy access. Limited parking

Name: *Jeram Kedah*
Description: Idyllic small waterfalls

Name: *Jeram Rusa*
Description: Small scenic waterfall for a quiet nature retreat. Short hike.

Name: *Jeram Tebrau*
Description: Baby fall near Seremban

Name: *Jeram Tengkek*
Description: Small attractive waterfall in recreation park

Name: *Jeram Toi*
Description: Well maintained park. Can be crowded during weekends

Name: *Pasong Falls*
Locality: Pertang - Batu Kikir Route N19 Simpang Pertang
Description: 5 small multi-level falls in quiet surroundings easily accessible from the road.

Name: *Serting Ulu*
Description: Recreation park with some small falls

Name: *Tambak Fall*
Locality: Pertang - Batu Kikir Route N19 Simpang Pertang
Description: Small falls in quiet surroundings easily accessible from the road.

Name: *Ulu Bendol*
Locality: Near Seremban on the road to Kuala Pilah
Description: Well visited recreation park with a small waterfall. Trailhead to Gunung Angsi

Name: *Bukit Tampin Falls*
Description: A decently sized waterfall in free to access Tampin Forest Reserve

Name: *Jeram Glami*
Description: A low height wide river cascade. Interesting spot to visit once recovered from flood devastation.

Name: *Jeram Lambar*
Description: Small slopped falls with a pool in oil palm estate backyard

Name: *Jeram Nerai Falls*
Description: A quiet and forgotten falls 1st documented and published in WoM Book

Name: *Lata Berembun (Closed)*
Description: Flood damage during the Dec 2021 has severely effected the area and entrance access.

Name: *Lata Kijang*
Description: Access has become easier recently. Possibly the tallest fall in the western part of Peninsular Malaysia

Name: *Bertangga Fall*
Description: A small but attractive waterfall hidden deep in the hills of Central Pahang

Name: *Chamang Fall*
Description: A powerful waterfall. Be aware of strong currents. Accidents have happened here.

Name: *Jeriau Fall*
Description: In a very landscaped park the nice waterfall comes as a surprise. Pool more suitable for wading than for swimming

Name: *Lata Jarum*
Locality: North of Raub at Kg Ulu Dong
Description: Popular weekend destination

Name: *Lata Lembik*
Description: Not a waterfall. Some rapids suitable for white water rafting

Name: *Lata Meraung*
Description: Small but very scenic waterfall

Name: *Lentang*
Description: Attractive Hutan Lipur with some rapids and Cascades

Name: *Pandan Fall*
Locality: On the road from Kuantan to Panching
Description: The waterfall is impressive tall broad and near vertical drop. Water volume depends on the season.

Name: *Parit Fall*
Description: Small attractive fall but quite polluted

Name: *Robinson Falls*
Description: Nice waterfall on walking distance of the village

Name: *Sg Dua falls (Lata Khong)*
Description: Unknown beautiful series of waterfalls not far from Karak. The lower tier is also known as Lata Khong

Name: *Sri Mahkota Fall*
Description: Remote waterfall in the Pahang section of Endau Rompin.

Name: *Teladas Falls*
Description: The waterfalls have known better times. Very murky water

Name: *Berkelah Falls*
Description: Beautiful series of waterfalls and Cascades  in the Berkelah river.

Name: *Gapoi Fall*
Locality: Near Gapoi on the road from Karak to Simpang Pertang
Description: Not often you will find such a large fall near to an inhabited area. Odeal for picnic and swimming

Name: *Genuai Fall*
Description: A rather tall near vertical fall in rocky surroundings

Name: *Jerangkang falls*
Description: Spectacular series of waterfalls. Similar to Berkelah but even more impressive.

Name: *Lata Tampit*
Description: Charming 7-tier waterfalls near Janda Baik

Name: *Lata Woh Falls*
Description: Multi-level falls with pools. Can be seasonal.

Name: *Perting Fall*
Description: Beautiful unspoilt waterfall. Descending to the fall from the path is not easy. Also known as Lata Hammers

Name: *Rainbow Fall*
Description: The famous rainbow is best seen in the morning

Name: *Seminyang Fall*
Locality: 12 km from Karak on the road to Kuala Pilah
Description: A powerful waterfall on the Pahang side of the Gunung Hantu Besar

Name: *Tanglir Falls*
Description: One of the most spectacular falls near Kuala Lumpur

Name: *Terapai Fall*
Description: Deep within the hills of Southern Pahang. Romantic setting.

Name: *Air Terjun Harimau Berjemur*
Description: Remote fall long 4WD access. Trekking easy

Name: *Berembun Fall*
Locality: 13 km from Kg Klau on the slopes of Gunung Benom
Description: This powerful fall can only be reached with a 4WD

Name: *Cemperoh Fall*
Description: Nice waterfall hidden in the jungle

Name: *Kenip Fall*
Locality: East of Sungei Koyan north of Raub
Description: Remote fall in Orang Asli country. Guide needed

Name: *Lata Nyangung*
Locality: South of Karak on the road to Simpang Pertang
Description: Intimidating tall waterfall

Name: *Sg Salan Falls*
Description: A wide single drop falls with a double Olympic size pool. But NO SWIMMING.

Name: *Batu Berangkai Falls*
Description: Gentle Cascades  with crystal clear water

Name: *Bukit Jana fall*
Description: Baby fall with a nice pool

Name: *Buntong Falls*
Description: Close to the town only known to locals. Surprisingly tall fall

Name: *Gepai Falls*
Description: A nice small waterfall near Bidor. Can be crowded during weekends.

Name: *Geruntum Fall*
Description: Interesting unspoilt waterfalls

Name: *Lata Batu Pecah*
Locality: near Manong 25 km west of Ipoh
Description: Unspoilt waterfall. Remote location

Name: *Lata Iskandar*
Locality: On the route from Tapah to the Cameron Highlands
Description: A popular stop on the way to the Cameron Highlands. Suitable place for family outings

Name: *Lata Kekabu*
Locality: Near Lenggong and the Chenderoh Lake
Description: Formerly know as the Sungei Tampan falls

Name: *Lata Kinjang*
Description: Dramatic Cascades. Prominent view from the North-South Highway. The upper part is of moderate difficulty.

Name: *Lata Perahu*
Description: Unspoilt waterfall in pristine surroundings

Name: *Lata Tebing Tinggi*
Description: The main waterfall is wide but not tall.

Name: *Lata Tengkoh Penyel*
Locality: Between Kampung Bawong and Kuala Mu
Description: Remote waterfall but easy access from carpark

Name: *Lata Ulu Chepor*
Description: Recreational site with Cascades  and small waterfalls. Popular during weekends. Crystal clear water

Name: *Lubuk Timah*
Description: Popular waterfalls and hot springs

Name: *Papan Cascades *
Description: Attractive Cascades  near the scenic ghost town of Papan

Name: *Salu Falls*
Description: Small pleasant falls in well maintained park

Name: *Sg Lalang Fall*
Locality: along the road from Simpang Pulai to the Cameron Highlands
Description: A small waterfall within easy reach of the road. Previously Sinju Fall

Name: *Tupai Fall*
Description: Small attractive waterfalls near Taiping

Name: *Ulu Licin falls*
Description: Unspoiled multi-tiered falls

Name: *Air Hitam Fall*
Locality: Near Batu Kurau north of Taiping
Description: Powerfull fall and Cascades . Pristine environment.

Name: *Belum falls*
Locality: Royal Belum & South Belum 30 km east of Gerik
Description: Many waterfalls. Access by boat only. Permit needed

Name: *Bersih Falls*
Description: Small falls near OS village

Name: *Chelik Fall*
Locality: near Simpang Pulai and the new road to the Cameron Highlands
Description: Remote Fall possibly the tallest fall in the western part of Peninsular Malaysia.

Name: *Damak Fall*
Description: A small attractive waterfall in Orang Asli country.

Name: *Kait Fall*
Locality: 15 km from Simpang Pulai along the CH road
Description: Pristine vertical fall

Name: *Kamunting Fall*
Description: Tall unspoiled fall visible from Kamunting

Name: *Lata Payong / Bayas*
Locality: Near Kg Kuak West of Lake Cenderoh
Description: Unknown waterfalls in the Bintang range

Name: *Lata Tanjung Kala*
Description: Located in beautiful and serene jungle. Not easy to find

Name: *Lata Yuk*
Description: Small brother of Lata Kinjang

Name: *Lon Rapids*
Description: Rapids in a tributary of the mighty Sungkai river. Located in pristine jungle

Name: *Maxwell Hill*
Description: Remote place but popular with locals. In this mountain range (Banjaran Bintang) there must be more waterfallsBintang) there must be more waterfalls

Name: *Tebing Tinggi Fall*
Description: Remote place but popular with locals. In this mountain range (Banjaran Bintang) there must be more waterfalls

Name: *Trong Falls*
Description: Remote waterfall. Unspoiled

Name: *Lata Puteh*
Locality: On the A6 between Selama and Lenggong
Description: Remote spectacular fall in the Ulu Gedong region.

Name: *Strata Falls*
Description: Beautiful and relatively unknown series of waterfalls on the slopes of G. Behrang.

Name: *Tibang Fall*
Description: Remote waterfall. Unspoiled

Name: *Tigok Fall*
Locality: Near Pos Gedong north-east of Bidor
Description: Remote spectacular fall in the Ulu Gedong region.

Name: *Batu Ferringi*
Description: Historically the most famous waterfall of Malaysia. Now out of bounds. A permit is needed for a visit.

Name: *Titi Kerawang*
Description: Carlson is on the trail to Kinabalu. Kipungit has easy access from the Poring Resort. For Langanan trekking is needed. The Kadamaian fall still has to be explored

Name: *Waterfall*
Description: Historically the most famous waterfall of Malaysia. Now out of bounds a permit is needed for a visit

Name: *Kinabalu Park Falls*
Description: Carlson is on the trail to Kinabalu. Kipungit has easy access from the Poring Resort. For Langanan trekking is needed. The Kadamaian fall still has to be xplored

Name: *Kionsom Fall*
Locality: Kampung Kobuni Ulu Kionsom Inanam Kota Kinabalu
Description: Popular waterfall near Kota Kinabalu

Name: *Madai Fall*
Description: Small romantic waterfalls in an unspoilt region within easy reach of Kuching

Name: *Mahua Fall*
Locality: near Kg Patau 15 minutes from Tambunan
Description: Beautiful vertical waterfall

Name: *The Maliau Basin*
Description: Beautiful falls in the as yet unspoilt interior of Sabah

Name: *Bobak Falls*
Locality: West of Kuching near Kg Bobak
Description: Small romantic waterfalls in an unspoilt region within easy reach of Kuching

Name: *Kubah Fall*
Locality: Kubah National park 20 km from Kuching
Description: Easily accessible fall in National park

Name: *Latak Falls*
Locality: Along the Bentulu-Miri road 30 km from Miri
Description: Clean and well maintained

Name: *Ranchan Falls*
Description: Well maintained Recreational Forest with nice waterfalls.

Name: *Santubong falls*
Description: Small attractive waterfalls near Kuching

Name: *Giam Klimau*
Description: Powerful remote waterfall near the Inodesian border

Name: *Gunung Gading Falls*
Description: There are six waterfalls in the Park but some of them are temporarily closed to the public.

Name: *Jangkar Fall*
Locality: West of Lundu near Indonesian border
Description: Powerful remote waterfall near the Inodesian border

Name: *Kg Sadir falls*
Locality: near Kg Sadir 50 km south of Kuching
Description: Four waterfalls in the remote Penrissen Range.Two of them have easy access. For the other two trekking is required.

Name: *Pantu Fall*
Locality: Lambir Hills NP 30 km from Miri
Description: Remote waterfalls difficult access. The Julan fall is the tallest fall of Sarawak

Name: *Sebarau Fall*
Locality: Near Kg Bidak south of Kuching
Description: Nice waterfall in unspoiled rural surroundings

Name: *Tajor Fall*
Description: This is a popular waterfall suitable for families but can be crowded during weekends

Name: *Usun Apau falls*
Description: Remote waterfalls with difficult access. The Julan fall is the tallest fall of Sarawak

Name: *Cheh Cascade Fall*
Description: This recreation park is within easy access from KL. The lower part is easy suitable for families. The upper falls require trekking.

Name: *Gabai Falls*
Description: This is a popular waterfall. Suitable for families but can be crowded during weekends

Name: *Jeram Anjang Fall*
Description: Private land access

Name: *Kanching Falls*
Description: Still unspoilt but for how long?

Name: *Komanwel Fall*
Description: Small waterfall in quiet surroundings

Name: *Perigi Tujuh*
Description: Not a real waterfall anymore. It has been replaced by seven wells and a dam. The effect however is quite picturesque

Name: *Sendat Falls*
Description: Still unspoilt but for how long?

Name: *Serendah Fall*
Description: A beautiful vertical drop. But ruined by developers....

Name: *Sungei Tua*
Description: A couple of nice waterfalls besides the road. Recreation park on the other side of the road

Name: *Tekala Falls*
Description: A popular recreation park in Hulu Langat. Suitable for families

Name: *Batangsi Fall*
Description: Cascades and rapids in the Sungei Batangsi.

Name: *Batu Asah Falls*
Description: A series of 6 small waterfalls near Zoo Negara

Name: *Batu Berayun Fall*
Description: A long hike and virtually unknown waterfall

Name: *Batu Bertengkek Falls*
Description: A rare contrast of a tall & a wide fall within stone throw reach of each other. Features unique rock boulders.

Name: *Batu Cherandong Dam Falls*
Description: A pre-independence water catchment dam fall with several smaller natural waterfalls on the same stream

Name: *Batu Kapal Falls*
Description: A beautiful fall at the end of an interesting river Trekking  during which you have to cross the river several times

Name: *Bukit Apeh Fall*
Locality: Ulu Langat FR access from Cheras
Description: Attractive fall near to the town

Name: *Chiling Falls*
Description: A beautiful fall at the end of an interesting river Trekking during which you have to cross the river several times

Name: *Gapi Fall*
Description: Scenic & tall waterfall. Majestic during wet seasons.

Name: *Gapok Falls*
Description: Waterfall series with 11 falls of different presentation. Popular during weekends.

Name: *Jeram Perlus*
Description: Unspoilt waterfall

Name: *Kedondong Fall*
Locality: Alongside the road between Batang Kali and Gohtong Jaya
Description: Unknown waterfall near popular recreation park

Name: *Lata Beringin Falls*
Description: Interesting multi-level falls beside a river campsite

Name: *Lata Medang*
Description: Two unspoilt waterfalls Bomoh Ali and Berembun. You must be able to swim to reach Berembun.

Name: *Lawing Falls*
Locality: Near Kg Sg Lui Ulu Langat region
Description: Unknown pristine waterfall in the backyard of KL

Name: *Lepok Fall*
Locality: in Ulu Langat near Kg Pangsun
Description: Lonely beautiful fall in Ulu Langat. A two hour trek is needed - worth the effort

Name: *Lolo Falls*
Description: Two unspoilt waterfalls - Bomoh Ali and Berembun. You must be able to swim to reach Berembun.

Name: *Lubuk Kawah Fall*
Description: Small unknown waterfall in the Ulu Langat region

Name: *Masai Falls*
Description: Unconventional cascade falls series in pristine jungle

Name: *Pangsun Fall*
Description: Small waterfall upriver of old hydro dam

Name: *Perdik Fall*
Description: Small unknown waterfall in the Ulu Langat region

Name: *Pisang Fall*
Locality: Near Gombak and the Karak Highway
Description: Remote powerful fall. Long access trail

Name: *Setinggi Fall*
Description: Unspoilt waterfall

Name: *Sg Ampang Falls*
Description: Unspoilt waterfalls in scenic surroundings. The first fall also known as Kemansah Fall

Name: *Sg Luit Falls*
Description: Remote powerful fall. Long access trail

Name: *Siong Fall*
Description: The tall cascade can be seen from the main road. An Orang Asli guide is advisable. Pristine conditions

Name: *Tarun Falls*
Description: A majestic falls can be seasonal during low rainfall.

Name: *Templer Falls*
Description: A nice family site near to the better known Kanching Falls

Name: *Ulu Tamu Falls*
Description: No waterfall some rapids only

Name: *Air Terjun Sekayu*
Description: Well maintained park with river Trekking

Name: *Belukar Bukit*
Description: No waterfall some rapids only

Name: *Lata Belatan*
Description: Recreation Park. Seasonal water flow

Name: *Lata Tembakah*
Description: Well visited and maintained park. Beautiful series of waterfalls

Name: *Jeram Penitih*
Description: Remote series of waterfalls in pristine surroundings

Name: *Kenyir Lake Falls*
Description: Remote fall pristine. Not very tall but almost vertical

Name: *Lata Cemerung*
Locality: Kg Pasir Raya along the inner road from Kuantan to Kuala Terengganu
Description: A very tall waterfall. Well maintained park

Name: *Lata Seru*
Description: Remote fall. Pristine. Not very tall but almost vertical

Name: *Belawan Falls*
Description: Very remote powerful waterfall. Pristine surroundings
